QuestionText: The unit of thermal conductivity is:
explanationText: The rate of heat flow $dQ/dt = -kA(dT/dx)$, where $k$ is thermal conductivity. Power (Watt) = $k \cdot [Area] \cdot [Temp. Gradient]$. So, $W = k \cdot m^2 \cdot K/m$. Thus, $k = W / (m \cdot K) = W m^{-1} K^{-1}$.

QuestionText: Which of the following pairs of physical quantities does not have same dimensional formula?
explanationText: Work ($[ML^2T^{-2}]$) and Torque ($[ML^2T^{-2}]$) have same dimensions. Angular momentum ($[ML^2T^{-1}]$) and Planck's constant ($[ML^2T^{-1}]$) have same dimensions. Impulse ($[MLT^{-1}]$) and Linear momentum ($[MLT^{-1}]$) have same dimensions. Tension is a Force ($[MLT^{-2}]$), while Surface Tension is Force per unit length ($[MT^{-2}]$). So, Tension and Surface Tension do not have the same dimensional formula.
